ygData.subject: Re: Flashback
ygData.msgSnippet: I petitioned  last night about tinkering, I asked the GM if tinkering was broken and he said no, then I asked why no one can make a colapseable fishing pole,
ygData.messageBody:
I petitioned last night about tinkering, I asked the GM if tinkering was
broken and he said no, then I asked why no one can make a colapseable
fishing pole, and he said that part was broken. So until they get a patch,
forget about the fishing pole.


Malbus
30 Wizard (wow, 30 sucks)
Tarew Marr


At 11:39 PM 10/2/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: "Nick Bock" <nickbock@...>
>
>Heya guys,
>
>Like i said quite a while ago, the gnome named Salvadori on Xegony is the
>one that has learned the secret of how to make the collapsable fishing pole,
>but is not willing to share the recipe. He's only one who can make them
>that I know of. Just a reminder of that info for those of you that weren't
>on the board, or who don't remember. Also, yes, he is not on very often
>anymore.
>
>Xalastile
>lvl 22 magician (retired)
>xegony
>
>
>>
>> I went ahead and talked to a gm and a bunch of higher level gnomes. From
>> the high levels gnomes I got the impression that tinkering was a complete
>> and total waste of time. In fact one told me he didn't do it because the
>> skill sucked and it wasn't worth it. I did get a name from a high level
>> gnome who said he knew someone who used to tinker a lot. He said the guys
>> name was salvadori or something like that and that he rarely came on. He
>> does however come on every once in a while. The other thing that I found
>> out, from the gm's, was that the skill is not broken. I asked every gm
>that
>> has been on for the past two nights and they all keep telling me it's not
>> broken. Well that's my search so far.
>>
>> Marcoux
>>
>> >
>
>>
>
